definition: martial arts competition/tournament/to compete in a contest
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
the pen is mightier than the sword (idiom)
pinyin: bi3 sheng4 yu2 dao1 wen2 bi3 wu3 qiang2

sentences.chinese: 騎士們騎馬比武，嬉戲作樂。

sentences.english: He told a fantastic tale of knights and jousting .
sentences.chinese: 他講了一個關於騎士和比武的幻想故事。

sentences.english: Party card see a set of he offered to and let me play three games two wins.
sentences.chinese: 方證見好話說盡便提出要和任我行比武三局二勝。

sentences.english: And SongBen endure LeiGang unexpectedly found on the eve of the tournament, the laurel orchid still in treasure zhi forest destruction.
sentences.chinese: 與松本忍比武前夕，雷剛竟發現桂蘭仍在寶芝林授徒。

sentences.english: She would no doubt have been anxious for something small in the way of a tournament.
sentences.chinese: 她無疑急於想要舉行一場小規模的馬上比武。

sentences.english: At this point, the clouds and inflammation in the tournament, the snow on the side for a slightly smaller tension.
sentences.chinese: 此時，雲和炎在比武，雪在一旁爲略遜一籌的炎緊張。

sentences.english: The honest truth is that there may not be a player more relatable to the common man than Sasha Vujacic.
sentences.chinese: 事實是，可能沒有人比武賈西奇更平凡普通。

sentences.english: Michiko jousting with any reporter, both die.
sentences.chinese: 美智子與何記者比武，雙雙死去。

sentences.english: I remember one time Baba took me to the yearly "Buzkashi" tournament that took place on the first day of spring, New Year's Day.
sentences.chinese: 我記得有個新年，爸爸帶我去看一年一度的比武競賽。

sentences.english: In the wushu competition, he kicked me down to the ground with a leg-sweep.
sentences.chinese: 比武時他用一個掃堂腿把我踢倒在地。

sentences.english: The palisades or fences enclosing the lists of a medieval tournament.
sentences.chinese: 用來圍住中世紀馬上比武大賽賽場的木欄或柵欄。

sentences.english: At length the barriers were opened and five knights advanced slowly into the area.
sentences.chinese: 比武場的門終於開了，五位騎士緩緩進入場內。

sentences.english: Laojiaohua, today you told me is winning the contest, or the normalization of life phase?
sentences.chinese: 老叫化，你今日跟我是比武決勝呢，還是性命相拚？

sentences.english: Jousting Wu Guanzhi use octupole punch to 3 recruit also an easy victory.
sentences.chinese: 比武中吳冠志使用八極拳讓對手3招還輕鬆獲勝。

definition: to have a competition/to measure with one's hand or arm/to make a gesture of measuring
single-elimination open tournament (the winner stays on until he is himself defeated)
to compare notes/to learn from one another/to swap pointers
to invite the groom (who will live with the bride's family)/to take a wife by one's own choice
elevated stage on which martial competitions or duels were held/arena/ring
(old) to fight on the leitai/(fig.) to enter a contest
